tasks.task: Participate in a project to improve cane growing practices and share knowledge with other growers.
subtasks: Research and join the 161 project for more information and alternative perspectives.
Tailor recommendations to each grower's specific farm needs.
Refine fertilizing programs based on best practices and the latest information.
Monitor and adjust nitrogen levels in fertilizers.
Implement Google Earth training to provide growers with farm data and nutrient management plans.
Organize and attend workshops, seminars, and field trips to learn from other growers.
Collaborate with pharmacists for unbiased advice on farm productivity.
Ensure farm management practices meet best management practices (BMP) standards and can withstand scrutiny.

tasks.task: Improve nutrient management on the farm and contribute to sustainable agricultural practices.
subtasks: Focus on reducing runoff from farms entering the reef.
Verify that fertilizers are applied according to crop demand to minimize excess.
Evaluate the impact of reduced nitrogen levels on crop health and financial outcomes.
Document and analyze the effectiveness of new fertilizing programs on crop quality and sustainability.

tasks.task: Enhance communication and knowledge sharing among growers through project activities.
subtasks: Utilize workshops and group discussions to exchange best practices and lessons learned.
Distribute educational materials, such as USB drives with farm data and nutrient management plans, to growers.
Facilitate peer-to-peer learning by bringing together diverse growers with different experiences and knowledge.
Encourage continuous improvement by promoting an ongoing learning mindset among participants.
